Text: FAQ legal Cc Could you please review answers to the current FAQs to check that they remain valid in relation to EOL Japan refer attached In addition could you please write answers for additional FAQs that were used in the Australian launch refer attached Feel free to add any additional comments that you think are relevant I would like to get this out to the translators by midnext week so would it be possible to have a look at your answers by Monday Regards Rousseau

Japanese Products on EnronOnlineDo you have any views on the following Forwarded by Rousseau AnaiENRONDEVELOPMENT on AM Anna CT PM To David nron cc Carol CT Mark CT Frank L CT Rousseau AnaiENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT Subject Japanese Products on EnronOnline Dave Carol Chew has raised some concerns with me regarding the offering of EOL Singapore Products in Japan This is as a result of a conference call that she participated in yesterday with Morten Erik Petterson Joe Hirl and John Chismar During the conference call Carol was informed that all GTCscounterparty approvalscredit limits tenor limits covering the trading of Singapore products in Japan have been drafted and approved by the US Legal credit teams Carol is concerned that if all Singapore products are to be offered in Japan that all legal and credit approvals for the products and the counterparties trading them should really be made by the relevant UK teams This is due to the fact that all OTC products currently traded in Singapore are governed by UK law and UK credit regulations Please could you advise how I should now proceed with this issue I have spoken to Justin Boyd about this and he has said that he has had no involvement in the approval of products to be traded in Japan Should I now be asking Justin to review the Singapore products types with the view to them being traded in Japan Thanks Anna

Password ApplicationIn your FAQ you might like to outline the contract structure in some detail for eg the counterparty contracts with Enron North America re PA contracts with ENA re ETA and contracts with Singapore re GTC Was there any particular reason that you chose the PA to be with ENA rather than Enron Japan Note Australia was done for the Australian market I would prefer to change it to Enron Japan Will we have to receive further external advice If not I will change it accordingly Regards Rousseau

FAQ EOL JapanIn your FAQ could you please put something about the tax consequences for Japanese counterparties Also sorry to rush you but we really need something by Friday Tokyo time so that we can put in in for translation Regards Rousseau

Re FAQ EOL JapanMark Thanks for your prompt reply Just one question Im anticipating from customers why cant the contracts PA and ETA be governed by Japanese law why did you choose NY law Can we change these to be governed by Japanese law this would be ideal Regards Rousseau Mark CT AM To Rousseau AnaiENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT cc Subject Re FAQ EOL Japan We generally do not give legal advice to our counterparties regarding tax or other legal consequences to their trading The only thing we could safely say would be something to the effect of If you are concerned about the tax consequences of your EnronOnline transactions please consult your tax advisor Rousseau NRONDEVELOPMENT PM To Mark CT cc Subject FAQ EOL Japan Mark In your FAQ could you please put something about the tax consequences for Japanese counterparties Also sorry to rush you but we really need something by Friday Tokyo time so that we can put in in for translation Regards Rousseau

FAQ legal Cc Could you please review answers to the current FAQs to check that they remain valid in relation to EOL Japan refer attached In addition could you please write answers for additional FAQs that were used in the Australian launch refer attached Feel free to add any additional comments that you think are relevant I would like to get this out to the translators by midnext week so would it be possible to have a look at your answers by Monday Regards Rousseau
